item.title: Take-Two Lays Off 30% of BioShock Studio
item.content:encoded:
Take-Two Interactive has laid off around 30% of staff at Cloud Chamber, the studio behind the next BioShock game, reports state.

Already a decade into development, the next BioShock game was due to be released in late 2026 or early 2027, but it will be delayed further, with the decision made to give the game more time in development.

More than 80 jobs were cut in the changes, with the studio said to have around 250 employees before the layoffs, representing a huge portion of the workforce.

1/3 of BioShock Studio Axed

The details are shared by Bloomberg’s Jason Schreier, which includes an email sent to staff by 2K President David Ismailer that states a decision was made to “rework certain aspects that are core to a BioShock game.”

This resulted in “reducing the size of the development team to focus on this work and give the game more time in development,” although BioShock is already one of the longest-running productions in gaming history.

Plans for the next BioShock instalment began in 2014, the year after the release of BioShock Infinite, though there were significant changes as Irrational Games, originally at the helm, was shattered by 2K after director Ken Levine left to start a smaller studio within Take-Two.

The report from Bloomberg says the trouble didn’t end there, with Certain Affinity taking the reins and working on the game for roughly two years, and a deal to acquire the studio fell through. Take-Two then decided to start an in-house studio to lead development, hiring in 2017 for what would become Cloud Chamber.

It’s not clear what the plan is now for the next BioShock game, though it’s clear that there won’t be a release window anytime soon, as the long wait will rumble on.

What are your thoughts about the long wait for a new entry in the BioShock series? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more news, take a look at the latest balance changes in Marvel Rivals, and read about Subnautica 2 developer Unknown Worlds suing the former leadership.

item.title: All Roblox Hunty Zombie Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Hunty Zombie is an action horror game in Roblox. Here is every active and expired reward code for the game this month.

If you love Roblox and games that let you bash zombies to bits, then Hunty Zombie will be perfect for you. Of course, fighting the undead isn’t always easy, so the game uses reward codes to let you unlock some free spins, among other rewards like cash.

Below, we’ve gathered all the active reward codes for August. We’ve also kept track of all expired codes, so you don’t waste your time entering old ones.

Every Active Roblox Hunty Zombie Code & Reward (August 2025)

Below, you can find all of the active codes for August 2025.

Codes are likely to expire over time, so make sure you use them before they do.

How to Redeem Hunty Zombie Codes in Roblox

To redeem codes, just follow the steps below:

  1. Launch Roblox and then the Hunty Zombie game.
  2. Press the Z key to bring up the ‘Codes’ option.
  3. Type in the code you want, and press ‘Redeem’.

If the code is still active, then you’ll receive the reward. Remember, you can only use a code once per user account.

All Expired Roblox Hunty Zombie Codes

As of August 2025, here are all the expired codes.

Remember, codes sometimes keep working after expiring, so it’s always worth giving them a try.

Where to Find Roblox Hunty Zombie Codes

While you’re here, make sure you bookmark this page. That’s because we’ll update it when new codes come in.

Remember, fresh and new codes usually to appear first on the game’s official Discord server. This is another great way to get codes before anyone else.

Be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best horror games in Roblox.

If you’re a big fan of horror games in Roblox, you can also check out our code guides for other creepfests like 99 Nights in the Forest, Pressure, and Inhuman.

item.title: Marvel Rivals August 20 Balance Changes—All Buffs & Nerfs
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals continues to get plenty of attention, and with the launch of a new limited-time game mode, several balance changes have also been made.

Now deep into Season 3.5, players will be forgiven for starting to look ahead to Season 4 and wondering what’s in store, but the launch of Klyntar’s Resource Rumble mode should keep you busy for the time being.

It’s worth keeping on top of all the balance changes, however, so you’re familiar with all the buffs and nerfs. We’ve got all the details for you here.

All Marvel Rivals August 20 Buffs & Nerfs

The Marvel Rivals balance changes on August 20 impact three heroes, with Blade, recently added at the start of Season 3.5, given a buff, while Human Torch and Loki receive a nerf.

Blade has boosted Lifesteal gained during Bloodline Awakening, boosted from 60% to 65%, while the self-healing reduction has been lowered from 40% to 35%.

Meanwhile, Human Torch’s Flame Field damage over time has been reduced to 20/s from 25/s, with Pyro-Prison damage also reduced from 50/s to 40/s.

In the Strategist department, Loki’s Mythical Missile damage dealt by the God of Mischief and his illusions has been reduced from 30 to 25, although healing for teammates remains unchanged.

All other characters in the game remain untouched, though don’t expect it to remain that way for long as the big end of season balance patch is now just a few weeks out.

Full Marvel Rivals Version 20250821 Patch Notes

The full patch notes are below, as shared on the official website.

Duelist

Blade

The Daywalker’s resilience just slightly leveled up. Blade’s got more staying power for those midnight brawls!

– Increase Lifesteal gained during Bloodline Awakening from 60% to 65%. Reduce self-healing reduction from 40% to 35%.

Human Torch

Johnny Storm’s heat is still on, but his flame’s been dialed back just enough for ground heroes to catch their breath!

– Reduce Flame Field (right-click on terrain) Damage Over Time from 25/s to 20/s.

– Reduce Pyro-Prison Damage Over Time from 50/s to 40/s.

Strategist

Loki

The God of Mischief and his illusions are a tad less punishing!

– Reduce Mystical Missile damage dealt by Loki and his illusions to enemies from 30 to 25. (Healing for teammates remains unchanged.)

What are your thoughts on the latest balance changes in Marvel Rivals? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Marvel Rivals, check out our exclusive stories on characters being planned for the next year, and take a look at Guangguang’s comments on future collabs.

item.title: Skate Promises Big Update Next Week as Early Access Looms
item.content:encoded:
Skate made an appearance during the Future Games Show at Gamescom, with the big announcement being a tease for a major update next week as Early Access looms.

The EA title, relaunching the franchise after a 15-year hiatus, has been in Closed Alpha stage for months, but with the end of the summer looming large, big news is seemingly on the horizon.

In a developer interview shown at Future Games Show, details were shared about development, including the in-depth parkour features, with a sign-off to keep eyes peeled for a big announcement next week.

Skate Poised For Big Update Ahead of Early Access

The comments at Future Games Show align with a recent post on X (formerly Twitter) directed to Skate Insiders, informing them that maintenance will take place from today, August 20, until August 26, leaving the game inaccessible.

With Summer 2025 stated as the release for Early Access, and just a few weeks left until we tick into September and leave the Summer behind, next week’s big update could well be the launch into Early Access.

Skate will be released on Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and PC, though it’s not clear yet whether the title will eventually make its way onto Nintendo Switch 2, nor do we know when a full launch will be.

Keep an eye on Skate’s social media channels for the big announcement next week, which we’ll also cover here at Insider Gaming.

Watch the full video below.

This is a breaking news story and is being updated.

Are you excited to finally delve into the world of Skate? What are your expectations? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Gamescom news, check out the reveal of Hell Let Loose: Vietnam, and take a look at the shadow drop of The Rogue Prince of Persia.
